title: The Project's Carrie Bickmore is left red-faced
text:
Live television can often result in a technical glitch or two.

And unfortunately that was the case for Carrie Bickmore, 38, on Wednesday's episode of Channel Ten's The Project.

After her co-host Gorgi Coghlan performed an acoustic version of Cold Chisel's Flame Trees, Carrie wanted to go over and congratulate her, but found herself 'attached' to the desk.

'I can't, I'm attached!' The Project's Carrie Bickmore was left red-faced after she became attached to panel on Wednesday night's episode of the show

As the show's theme music began to play, the panel, including Tommy Little and Hamish Macdonald, got up to give Gorgi a congratulatory hug.

But Carrie struggled to move, reaching inside her one-shoulder green dress in an attempt to remove her microphone pack.

'Gorgi, Gorgi! She can't hear,' Carrie yelled out in an attempt to get the brunette's attention.

Oh dear: After her co-host Gorgi Coghlan performed an acoustic version of Cold Chisel's Flame Trees, Carrie wanted to go over and congratulate her, but found herself 'attached' to the desk

Stuck! As the show's theme music began to play, the panel, including Tommy Little and Hamish Macdonald, got up to give Gorgi a congratulatory hug, but Carrie struggled to move

'I can't [come over],' the blonde added. 'I'm attached [to the desk].'

It was certainly a day for Carrie, who was earlier forced to rummage through a garbage bin at the Hit Network offices just hours earlier, desperately searching for a lost autograph from actress Sarah Jessica Parker.

What a day! It was certainly a day for Carrie, who was earlier forced to rummage through a garbage bin at the Hit Network offices just hours earlier, desperately searching for a lost autograph from actress Sarah Jessica Parker

'I don't think we've ever seen Carrie so low,' her co-host Tommy Little wrote alongside the embarrassing Instagram video.

'Don't film me doing this, it's weird!' Carrie yelled in the footage.

Unfortunately, she was unable to locate the missing slip of paper.

But all was not lost, as Sarah commented below the post and said she would happily sign another autograph for Carrie.

Thoughtful: But all was not lost, as Sarah commented below the post and said she would happily sign another autograph for Carrie
description: Live television can often result in a technical glitch or two.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
